{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, the sterilization of hand pieces can cause turbine wear. Document [12] mentions that steam autoclaving, which is the most commonly used sterilization method, can cause corrosion and partial combustion of the handpiece lubricant, leaving a sticky carbon residue on the turbine. This indicates that the sterilization process can lead to wear and damage to the turbine of the hand piece.", "answer_choice": "B"}
